SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Account for Updated Cart Data in Front-End Extensions

The Shopping Cart page version 2.0 introduces some changes to the Backbone.js data model for shopping cart data. These changes can affect how the Handlebars templates that render the Shopping Cart page display cart data.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

How: After you upgrade the available global data, the new cart data is used.

If you extended the default Handlebars templates for rendering cart data, update your extensions to handle the new cart data, if necessary:

Complete the steps for requesting access to the secured documentation for B2B Commerce for Visualforce, which includes a reference for the default Handlebars templates.
Find the reference for the default cc_CartInc3 and cc_CartIncRD2 templates.
Compare your extensions against the default templates, and make appropriate updates to handle the new cart data.
NOTE B2B Commerce for Visualforce continues support for the Shopping Cart page version 1.0. To revert, change the Use Cart Page 2.0 configuration setting to FALSE.

title: Upgrading B2B Commerce for Visualforce: Release Notes and Guide
